column1: ###### Religion names, descriptions, titles, gods etc.

column2: The Paulicians were a Christian Adoptionist sect, also accused by medieval sources of being Gnostic and quasi-Manichaean Christian. They flourished between 650 and 872 in Armenia and the Eastern Themes of the Byzantine Empire. According to medieval Byzantine sources, the group's name was derived from the 3rd century Bishop of Antioch, Paul of Samosata.
column3: Les Pauliciens étaient une secte chrétienne adoptianiste, également accusé par les sources médiévales d'être gnostique et quasi manichéenne chrétienne. Ils ont prospéré entre 650 et 872 en Arménie et dans les Thèmes orientaux de l'Empire byzantin. Selon des sources byzantines médiévales, le nom du groupe dérive du nom de l'évêque d'Antioche du 3ème siècle, Paul de Samosate.

column2: The Holy See of Aquilea, together with other northern Italian bishops split from the church in Rome in 553 from the disagreement regarding the 2nd Council of Constantinople, attempting to reconcile western and middle-eastern Christian views on the nature of Christ. They proclaimed a Patriarch in Aquilea, thus beginning what would be known as the "Schism of the Three Chapters". .

Total depravity is a theological doctrine derived from the Augustinian concept of original sin. It is the teaching that, as a consequence of the Fall of Man, every person born into the world is enslaved to the service of sin and, apart from the efficacious or prevenient grace of God, is utterly unable to choose to follow God, refrain from evil, or accept the gift of salvation as it is offered.
column3: La corruption totale est une doctrine théologique dérivée de la  augustinisme du péché originel. Elle enseigne que l'homme est devenu l'esclave du péché à la suite de la Chute et est devenu incapable d'accepter le salut même lorsque celui-ci lui est offert.

column2: A heresy espoused by the Presbyter Eutyches in Contantinople, in reaction to the Nestorian controversy. He claimed that Christ was a fusion of human and divine elements.
column3: Une hérésie épousée par le Prêtre Eutychès à Constantinople, par rapport à la controverse nestorienne. Il a affirmé que le Christ était une fusion d'éléments humains et divins.

column2: Binitarianism is a Christian theology of duality, two personae, two individuals, or two aspects in one Godhead (or God). Classically, binitarianism is understood as a form of monotheism — that is, that God is an absolutely single being, and yet with binitarianism there is a "twoness" in God. The other common forms of monotheism are "unitarianism", a belief in a single God with one aspect, and "trinitarianism", a belief in a single God with three aspects.
column3: Le Binitarianisme est une théologie chrétienne de la dualité, deux personae, deux individus ou deux aspects dans une Divinité (ou Dieu). Classiquement, le Binitarianisme est compris comme une forme de monothéisme - qui est, que Dieu est un être absolument unique, et pourtant avec le Binitarianisme il y a un "dédoublement" en Dieu. Les autres formes courantes de monothéisme sont l'Unitarianisme, une croyance en un Dieu unique avec un aspect, et le Trinitarianisme" une croyance en un Dieu unique avec trois aspects.

column2: Pelagianism is the belief that original sin did not taint human nature and that mortal will is still capable of choosing good or evil without special Divine aid. This is still sometimes called Limited Depravity. Thus, in contrast to 1 Corinthians 15:19-22, Adam's sin was "to set a bad example" for his progeny, but his actions did not have the other consequences imputed to original sin. Pelagianism views the role of Jesus as "setting a good example" for the rest of humanity as well as providing an atonement for our sins. In short, humanity has full control, and thus full responsibility, for obeying the Gospel in addition to full responsibility for every sin. According to Pelagian doctrine, because humans are sinners by choice, they are therefore criminals who need the atonement of Jesus Christ. Sinners are not victims, they are criminals who need pardon.
column3: Pélagianisme est la croyance que le péché originel n'a pas entaché la nature humaine et cette volonté mortelle est encore capable de choisir le bien ou le mal, sans aide divine spéciale. Ceci est encore parfois appelé limitée Dépravation. Ainsi, contrairement à 1 Corinthiens 15: 19-22, le péché d'Adam était "un mauvais exemple" pour sa descendance, mais ses actions n'avaient pas d' autres conséquences imputées au péché originel. Le pélagianisme considère le rôle de Jésus comme "donnant l'exemple" pour le reste de l'humanité tout en fournissant une expiation pour nos péchés. En bref, l'humanité a le plein contrôle, et donc l'entière responsabilité, pour obéir à l'Évangile, en plus de l'entière responsabilité de tout péché. Selon la doctrine de Pélage, c'est parce que les humains sont pécheurs par choix, qu'ils sont donc des criminels qui ont besoin de l'expiation de Jésus-Christ. Les pécheurs ne sont pas des victimes, ce sont des criminels qui ont besoin du pardon.

column2: Any view which holds that Christians are freed by grace from obligations of any moral law, and thus can sin at will if they ask for forgiveness. Saint Paul had to refute a charge of this type made by opponents because of his attitude to the Mosaic Law.
column3: Toute vue qui soutient que les chrétiens sont libérés par la grâce d'obligations de toute loi morale, et peut donc pécher à volonté s'ils demandent pardon. Saint Paul a dû réfuter une accusation de ce genre faite par des opposants en raison de son attitude envers la loi mosaïque.

column2: §Y*§! Antinomians can commit incest, as long as they ask for forgiveness afterwards \n§Y*§! Antinomians do not reject the pleasures of the flesh, as long as they ask for forgiveness afterwards \n§Y*§! Antinomians are shunned by other Christians, and thus tend to rely on each other more.
column3: §Y*§! Les Antinomiens peuvent commettre l'inceste, aussi longtemps qu'ils demandent pardon après \n§Y*§! Les Antinomiens ne rejettent pas les plaisirs de la chair, aussi longtemps qu'ils demandent pardon après \n§Y*§! Les Antinomiens sont rejetés par d'autres Chrétiens, et ont donc tendance à compter les uns sur les autres plus.

column2: Ebionites, or Ebionaioi, is a patristic term referring to a Jewish Christian movement that existed during the early centuries of the Christian Era. They regarded Jesus of Nazareth as the Messiah while rejecting his divinity and insisted on the necessity of following Jewish law and rites. The Ebionites used only one of the Jewish Gospels, revered James the Just and rejected Paul of Tarsus as an apostate from the Law. Their name suggests that they placed a special value on voluntary poverty. They have been identified as the meek and the poor Jesus spoke of in the Beatitudes, and the Ebionim was one of the terms used by the sect that sought to separate themselves from the corruption of the Temple, at Qumran, whom many believe were the Essenes.
column3: Les Ébionites, est un terme patristique se référant à un mouvement judéo-chrétien qui existait pendant les premiers siècles de l'ère chrétienne. Ils considéraient Jésus de Nazareth comme le Messie tout en rejetant sa divinité et insistaient sur la nécessité de suivre la loi juive et les rites. Les Ébionites utilisaient seulement les Évangiles juifs, vénéraient Jacques le Juste et rejetaient Paul de Tarse comme un apostat de la loi. Leur nom suggère qu'ils ont placé une valeur spéciale sur la pauvreté volontaire. Ils ont été identifiés comme les humbles et les pauvres Jésus a parlé dans les Béatitudes et l'Ébionisme a été l'un des termes utilisés par la secte qui cherchait à se séparer de la corruption du Temple, à Qumrân, dont beaucoup pensent étaient les Esséniens .

column2: Marcionism was an Early Christian dualist belief system that originated in the teachings of Marcion of Sinope at Rome around the year 144 AD. Marcion believed Jesus Christ was the savior sent by God, and Paul of Tarsus was his chief apostle, but he rejected the Hebrew Bible and the God of Israel. Marcionists believed that the wrathful Hebrew God was a separate and lower entity than the all-forgiving God of the New Testament. This belief was in some ways similar to Gnostic Christian theology. Notably, both are dualistic, that is, they posit opposing gods, forces, or principles: one higher, spiritual, and "good", and the other lower, material, and "evil" (compare Manichaeism), in contrast to the orthodox Christian view that "evil" has no independent existence, but is a privation or lack of "good", a view shared by the Jewish theologian Moses Maimonides.
column3: Le marcionisme était un système de croyance dualiste du Christianisme Primitif qui a pris naissance dans les enseignements de Marcion de Sinope à Rome vers l'an 144 AD. Marcion croyait que Jésus-Christ était le sauveur envoyé par Dieu, et Paul de Tarse était son chef apôtre, mais il a rejeté la Bible hébraïque et le Dieu d'Israël. Les marcionites croyaient que le courroucée Dieu hébreu était une entité distincte et inférieure à Dieu qui pardonne tout le Nouveau Testament. Cette croyance était à certains égards similaires à la théologie gnostique chrétienne. Notamment, les deux sont dualistes, c'est-à-dire, ils posent des dieux, des forces ou des principes opposés: l'un plus élevé, spirituel, et "bon", et l'autre inférieur, matériel, et "mauvais" (comparer Manichaeism), contrairement aux orthodoxes qui voient le "mal" comme n'ayant pas d'existence indépendante, mais comme une privation ou le manque de "bon", une opinion partagée par le théologien juif Moïse Maïmonide.

column2: Montanism was an early Christian movement of the late 2nd century, later referred to by the name of its founder, Montanus. It is a prophetic movement that calls for a reliance on the spontaneity of the Holy Spirit and a more conservative personal ethic.
column3: Le montanisme était un mouvement chrétien primitif de la fin du 2ème siècle, plus tard désigné par le nom de son fondateur, Montanus. Il est un mouvement prophétique qui appelle au recours aux de la spontanéité du Saint-Esprit et une éthique personnelle plus conservatrice.

column2: Valentinus and the Gnostic movement that bore his name were considered threats to Christianity by church leaders and Christian scholars, not only because of their influence, but also because of their doctrine, practices and beliefs. Gnostics were condemned as heretics, and prominent Church fathers such as Irenaeus of Lyons and Hippolytus of Rome wrote against Gnosticism. Most evidence for the Valentinian theory comes from its critics and detractors, most notably Irenaeus, since he was especially concerned with refuting Valentinianism.
column3: Valentinus et le mouvement gnostique qui portait son nom ont été considérées comme des menaces au christianisme par les dirigeants de l'Eglise et les érudits chrétiens, non seulement en raison de leur influence, mais aussi à cause de leur doctrine, pratiques et croyances. Les gnostiques furent condamnés comme hérétiques, et les pères de l'Église de renom comme Irénée de Lyon et Hippolyte de Rome ont écrit contre le gnosticisme. La plupart des preuves de la théorie Valentinien viennet de ses critiques et ses détracteurs, notamment Irénée, car il était particulièrement préoccupé à réfuter le Valentinianisme.

column2: Belief that Jesus had a human body and lower soul but a divine mind. Apollinaris further taught that the souls of men were propagated by other souls, as well as their bodies.
column3: La croyance que Jésus avait un corps humain et l'âme inférieure, mais un esprit divin. Apollinaire enseigna en outre que les âmes des hommes ont été propagées par d'autres âmes, ainsi que leurs corps.

column2: Belief that Jesus was a mere man that was adopted as the Son of God.
column3: La croyance que Jésus était un homme quelconque qui est devenu le fils de Dieu par adoption

column2: Belief that Jesus' physical body was an illusion, as was his crucifixion,  that is, Jesus only seemed to have a physical body and to physically die, but in reality he was incorporeal, a pure spirit, and hence could not physically die
column3: La croyance que le corps physique de Jésus était une illusion, tout comme sa crucifixion, c'est-à-dire, Jésus ne semblait avoir un corps physique et mourir physiquement, mais en réalité, il était incorporel, un pur esprit, et donc ne pouvait pas mourir physiquement

column2: While accepting the divinity of Jesus Christ as affirmed at Nicea in 325, they denied that of the Holy Spirit which they saw as a creation of the Son, and a servant of the Father and the Son.
column3: Tout en acceptant la divinité de Jésus-Christ comme affirmé à Nicée en 325, ils ont nié le Saint- Esprit qu'ils voyaient comme une création du Fils, et un serviteur du Père et du Fils.

column2: Belief that the Father and Son are not two distinct persons, and thus God the Father suffered on the cross as Jesus.
column3: La croyance que le Père et le Fils ne sont pas deux personnes distinctes, et donc Dieu le Père a souffert sur la croix comme Jésus.

column2: Belief that the Father, Son, and Holy Spirit are three characterizations of one God, rather than three distinct "persons" in one God.
column3: La croyance que le Père, le Fils et le Saint-Esprit sont trois caractérisations d'un seul Dieu, au lieu de trois "personnes" distinctes en un seul Dieu.

column2: Belief that Jesus is "merely human": either that he never became divine, or that he never existed prior to his incarnation as a man.
column3: La croyance que Jésus est "purement humain": soit qu'il n'a jamais été divin, ou qu'il n'a jamais existé avant son incarnation comme un homme.

column2: Belief that God has human form and that one ought to celebrate Jesus' death during the Jewish Passover.
column3: La croyance que Dieu a une forme humaine et que l'on doit célébrer la mort de Jésus pendant la Pâque juive.

column2: An overemphasis on the indivisibility of God at the expense of the other "persons" of the Trinity leading to either Sabellianism or to Adoptionism.
column3: Un accent excessif sur l'indivisibilité de Dieu au détriment des autres "personnes" de la Trinité menant soit au Sabellianisme soit à l'Adoptionisme.

column2: Donatists were rigorists, holding that the church must be a church of "saints," not "sinners," and that sacraments, such as baptism, administered by Traditores ("traitors", sinful, traitorous clergy) were invalid. Probably in 311 AD, a new bishop of Carthage, Caecilian, was consecrated by someone who had allegedly been a Traditor, Felix of Aptungi, his opponents consecrated a short-lived rival, who was succeeded by Donatus, after whom the schism was named. In 313, a commission appointed by Pope Miltiades fought against the Donatists, but they continued to exist, viewing themselves, and not the Catholic Church, as the "true Church," the only one with "valid sacraments". As such, any clergyman considered "impure" was immediately removed from their position. Contrasted with the ichthys and the Christian cross, Donatists most commonly used Noah's Ark to represent themselves.
column3: Les donatistes étaient rigoristes, estimant que l'Église doit être une Église de "saints" et non de "pécheurs", et que les sacrements, comme le baptême, administrés par traditores étaient invalides. Probablement en 311, un nouvel évêque de Carthage, Cécilien, a été consacrée par quelqu'un qui auraient été traditor, Felix de Aptungi, ses adversaires consacrèrent un rival de courte durée, qui a été remplacé par Donatus, après que le schisme a été déclenché. En 313, une commission nommée par le pape Miltiade lutta contre les donatistes, mais ils continuèrent à exister, à se voir, et non pas l'Église catholique, comme la "véritable Église", la seule avec des "sacrements valides."

column2: §Y*§! Can found a Holy Order if Carthage is restored.\n§Y*§! Can restore the Bishop of Carthage as a religious head.\n§Y*§! Can declare the Lapsi against fellow members.
column3: §Y*§! Peut fonder un ordre saint si Carthage est rétablie.\n§Y*§! Peut restaurer l'évêque de Carthage en tant que chef religieux.\n§Y*§! Peut déclarer le Lapsi contre d'autres membres.

column2: Denial of the true divinity of Jesus Christ taking various specific forms, but all agreed that Jesus Christ was created by the Father, that he had a beginning in time, and that the title "Son of God" was a courtesy one.
column3: Déni de la vraie divinité de Jésus-Christ en prenant diverses formes spécifiques, mais tous d'accord que Jésus-Christ a été créé par le Père, qu'il avait un commencement dans le temps, et que le titre de "Fils de Dieu" était une courtoisie.

column2: Tzadikite, meaning "righteous one", represents the mystical and Khabbalistic form of Judaism practiced mainly by the Juhuri people in the Caucasian Mountains. Highly militaristic, this form of Judaism is centered on martial prowess and skill.

Sethianism is a polytheistic, ancient Gnostic system revering Seth, son of Adam, and Sophia, goddess of wisdom, as divine incarnations. Sethians believe in a "backstory" to the Book of Genesis, in which an evil force called Yaldabaoth and his henchmen, the Archons, spawned Creation, in imitation of a perfect spiritual world under the True Unknown God. Yaldabaoth did this, Sethians say, by stealing the Power of the mother goddess, Sophia (meaning "wisdom"), whose Power Yaldabaoth accidently transferred into humanity, which he then removed from them by torment. The Power was transferred into the Tree of Knowledge of Good and Evil. They hold the belief that the snake in the Garden of Eden was an agent of the true God and brought knowledge of truth to man via the Fall of Man in defiance of Yaldabaoth's order, which they see as the beginning of humanity's liberation from Yaldabaoth's tyranny.
column3: Le gnosticisme séthien est un ancien système gnostique polythéiste, vénérant Seth, fils d'Adam, et Sophia, déesse de la sagesse, comme des incarnations divines. Les séthiens croient en une "trame de fond" du Livre de la Genèse, dans laquelle une force maléfique appelée Yaldabaoth et ses acolytes, les Archontes, ont donné naissance à la Création à l'imitation d'un monde spirituel parfait dans le vrai Dieu inconnu. Yaldabaoth a fait cela, disent les Séthiens, en volant la puissance de la déesse mère, Sophia (qui signifie «sagesse»), que Yaldabaoth transféra accidentellement dans l'humanité, qu'il a ensuite retiré d'eux par le tourment. Le pouvoir a été transféré dans l'Arbre de la Connaissance du Bien et du Mal. Ils détiennent la conviction que le serpent dans le Jardin d'Eden était un agent du vrai Dieu et apporta la connaissance de la vérité à l'homme par la Chute de l'Homme, au mépris de l'ordre de Yaldabaoth, qu'ils considèrent comme le début de la libération de l'humanité de la tyrannie de Yaldabaoth.

column2: The central church of the Pentarchy, and the main faith of the two empires.
column3: L'église centrale de la Pentarchie, et la foi principale des deux empires.

column2: In the British Isles, there were a distinct number of practices and traditions that made Jesus' Brythonic and Gaelic followers different to their continental contemporaries. These include a distinctive system for determining the dating of Easter, a style of monastic tonsure, a unique system of penance, and the popularity of going into "exile for Christ". The monasteries that were founded in the most wild and secluded places of the British Isles produced some of the greatest works of art ever to honour God's name and their saints went on to spread the Gospel from the Alpine slopes of St Gallen and Salzburg to the frigid isolation of the Faroe Islands and Iceland. After the Synod of Whitby or Streanœhealh in 664 these traditions began to decline as Britannia's, Hibernia's and Caledonia's Christians practiced the rites of Rome more than their own traditions. Yet their spiritualism and artwork always left a distinctive mark on the inhabitants of the British Isles. In the mod, they are a separate branch of Christianity, and may have church councils fire with the Nicene church.
column3: Dans les îles britanniques, il y avait un certain nombre distinct de pratiques et traditions qui ont fait des disciples brittoniques et gaéliques de Jésus différents de leurs contemporains continentaux. Celles-ci comprennent un système distinct pour la détermination de la date de Pâques, un style de la tonsure monastique, un système unique de la pénitence, et la popularité d'entrer dans "l'exil pour le Christ". Les monastères qui ont été fondées dans les lieux les plus sauvages et isolés des îles britanniques ont produit quelques-unes des plus grandes œuvres d'art jamais réalisées pour honorer le nom de Dieu et leurs saints ont continué à répandre l'Évangile des pistes alpines de St-Gall et de Salzbourg à l'isolement froid des îles Féroé et l'Islande. Après le Synode de Whitby ou Streanœhealh en 664 ces traditions ont commencé à diminuer à mesure que les chrétiens de Britannia, d'Hibernia et de Caledonia pratiquaient les rites de Rome plus que leurs propres traditions. Pourtant, leur spiritualisme et les illustrations laissaient toujours un signe distinctif sur les habitants des îles britanniques. Dans le mod, ils sont une branche distincte du christianisme, et peuvent avoir des conseils d'église enflammés avec l'église de Nicée.

column2: The Georgian Orthodox Church is the head church of the Georgian people, founded by the Kingdom of Iberia.
column3: L'Église orthodoxe géorgienne est l'église principale du peuple géorgien, fondée par le Royaume d'Iberia.

column2: Unified Muslim religion founded by the Islamic Prophet
column3: Religion musulmane unifiée fondée par le prophète islamique

column2: Abadites or Ibadites are a Moslem sect named after its founder Jaber Ibn Zayd. The Abadites still have a small number of followers in Oman, the island of Djerba, Tripolitania, Tunis and Algeria. Around the middle of the 8th century the Abadite missionary 'Abdullah ibn-Yahya, called Talib al-Haqq (The Seeker after Right), set out from Basrah, began preaching in Yemen and built up a kind of theocratic dominion all over south-west Arabia. In spite of various vicissitudes and suppressions the Abadite imams succeeded in maintaining their power for some 900 years. The descendants of the few who could escape into the secluded valleys of the Hadramawt have remained faithful to their creed down to this day. Notwithstanding their wide dispersion the various Abadite groups show a remarkable coherence.
column3: Les Abadites ou les Ibadites sont une secte musulmane du nom de son fondateur Jaber Ibn Zayd. Les Abadites ont encore un petit nombre d'adeptes en Oman, l'île de Djerba, la Tripolitaine, Tunis et l'Algérie. Vers le milieu du 8ème siècle, le missionnaire Abadite 'Abdullah ibn-Yahya, appelé Talib al-Haqq (Le Chercheur après le Droit), partit de Basrah, a commencé à prêcher au Yémen et a construit une sorte de domination théocratique partout dans le sud-ouest de l'Arabie. En dépit de diverses vicissitudes et suppressions des imams Abadites ont réussi à maintenir leur pouvoir pour quelque 900 ans. Les descendants de quelques-uns qui ont pu échapper aux vallées isolées du Hadramawt sont restés fidèles à leur foi jusqu'à ce jour. Malgré leur grande dispersion des différents groupes Abadites montrent une cohérence remarquable.

column2: The Qarmatians were a syncretic religious group that combined elements of the Shi'a Ismaili branch of Islam with Persian mysticism centered in eastern Arabia, where they attempted to establish a utopian republic in 899 CE. They are most famed for their revolt against the Abbasid Caliphate. Mecca was sacked by the sect’s leader Ahir Sulayman, outraging the Muslim world, particularly with their theft of the Black Stone and desecration of the Well of Zamzam with corpses during the Hajj season of 930 CE. The Qarami?ah were also known as "the Greengrocers" because of their strict vegetarian habits.

Quranism is an Islamic movement that holds the Qur'an to be the most authentic criterion in Islam. Quranists generally reject the religious authority of Hadith. This in contrast to the Sunni, Shia and Ibadi doctrines which consider hadith essential for the Islamic faith.

Uwaisiyaan refers to those Sufis who have gained the spiritual chain from another Sufi without physically meeting them in this world. Usually "Uwaisian" are known as a school in Tasawwuf, and the word Uwaisi is its singular form. The "Uwaisi " form of spiritual transmission in the vocabulary of Islamic mysticism was named after Awais Malik (Uwais al-Qarni), as it refers to the transmission of spiritual knowledge between two individuals without the need for physical interaction between them.
column3: Uwaisiyaan désigne les Soufis qui ont acquis la chaîne spirituelle d'un autre soufi sans les rencontrer physiquement dans ce monde. Habituellement les "Uwaisian" sont connus comme une école de tasawwuf, et le mot Uwaisi est sa forme singulière. La forme "Uwaisi" de transmission spirituelle dans le vocabulaire de la mystique islamique a été nommé d'après Awais Malik (Uwais al-Qarni), car il se réfère à la transmission de la connaissance spirituelle entre deux individus, sans la nécessité d'une interaction physique entre eux.

column2: The Salafi movement, also known as the Salafi methodology and the Salafist movement, is a movement or sect within Sunni Islam that takes its name from the term salaf ("predecessors", "ancestors") used to identify the earliest Muslims, who, its adherents believe, provide the epitome of Islamic practice
column3: Le mouvement salafiste est un mouvement ou une secte au sein de l'islam sunnite qui prend son nom du terme salaf ("prédécesseurs", "ancêtres") utilisés pour identifier les premiers musulmans, qui, ses adhérents croient, fournissent la quintessence de la pratique islamique.

column2: Twelver Shia or the Ithna'ashariyyah' is the largest branch of Shia Islam, and it will become the main branch of the religion is the future. The term Twelver is derived from the doctrine of believing in twelve divinely ordained leaders, known as The Twelve Imams. Twelver Shia are also known as Imami or Ja'fari, originated from the name of the 6th Imam, Ja'far al-Sadiq, who elaborated the twelver jurisprudence
column3: Le Chiisme duodécimain ou Ithna'ashariyyah 'est la plus grande branche de l'islam chiite, et deviendra la branche principale de la religion à l'avenir. Le terme duodécimain est dérivé de la doctrine de la foi en douze chefs divinement ordonnés, appelés Les Douze Imams. Les chiites duodécimain sont également connus comme Imami ou Ja'fari, provenant du nom de la 6e Imam, Ja'far al-Sadiq, qui a élaboré la jurisprudence duodécimaine.

column2: Ismailis get their name from their acceptance of Isma'il ibn Jafar as the divinely appointed spiritual successor to Ja'far al-Sadiq, wherein they differ from the Twelvers, who accept Musa al-Kadhim, younger brother of Isma'il, as the true Imam. Over time, the teachings of Ismailism further transformed into the belief system as it is known today, with an explicit concentration on the deeper, esoteric meaning (ba?in) of the faith. With the eventual development of Twelverism into the more literalistic (zahir) oriented Akhbari and later Usuli schools of thought, Shiaism developed in two separate directions: the metaphorical Ismailli group focusing on the mystical path and nature of God and the divine manifestation in the personage of the "Imam of the Time" as the "Face of God", with the more literalistic Twelver group focusing on divine law and the deeds and sayings Muhammad and his successors, who as A'immah were guides and a light to God.

Wahhabism is an ultra-conservative, extremist, violent branch or sect of Sunni Islam. It is a religious movement among fundamentalist Islamic believers, with an aspiration to return to the earliest fundamental Islamic sources of the Quran and Hadith, with inspiration from the teachings of Medieval theologian Ibn Taymiyyah and early jurist Ahmad ibn Hanbal. Wahhabis refuse to tolerate the presence of any other religion and seek to spread their faith by the sword. Wahhabism would remain a violent force of Islam for centuries after many other Islamic sects died, going toe to toe with the greatest empires and countries the world has ever known, and successfully blindsiding them with sporadic acts of terror and violence.
column3: Le Wahhabisme est une branche extrémiste, violente, ultra-conservatrice ou une secte de l'islam sunnite. C'est un mouvement religieux parmi les croyants fondamentalistes islamiques, avec une aspiration à revenir aux sources islamiques fondamentales plus anciennes du Coran et du Hadith, avec l'inspiration des enseignements du théologien médiéval Ibn Taymiyya et les premiers de jurisprudence de Ahmad ibn Hanbal. Les Wahhabites refusent de tolérer la présence de toute autre religion et cherchent à répandre leur foi par l'épée. Le Wahhabisme demeurerait une force violente de l'Islam pendant des siècles après que beaucoup d'autres sectes islamiques moururent, faisant face avec les plus grands empires et les pays du monde ait jamais connu, et aveuglant avec succès par des actes sporadiques de terreur et de violence.

column2: The Sunnis view the Mahdi as the successor of Mohammad. The Mahdi is expected to arrive to rule the world and to reestablish righteousness. The Mahdi is not described in the Quran but only in hadith, with scholars suggesting that he arose when some Arabian tribes were settling in Syria under Mo’awiya. “They anticipated ‘the Mahdi who will lead the rising people of the Yemen back to their country’ in order to restore the glory of their lost Himyarite kingdom. It was believed that he would eventually conquer Constantinople.
column3: Les sunnites considèrent le Mahdi comme le successeur de Mohammad. Le Mahdi devrait arriver à gouverner le monde et à rétablir la justice. Le Mahdi n'est pas décrit dans le Coran, mais seulement dans le hadith, avec des chercheurs suggérant qu'il surgi lorsque certaines tribus arabes s'installaient en Syrie sous Mo'awiya. "Ils ont anticipé le Mahdi qui dirigera le peuple hausse du Yémen à son pays" afin de rétablir la gloire de leur royaume Himyarite perdu. On a cru qu'il finirait par conquérir Constantinople.

column2: Zaydis, the oldest branch of the Shia and the largest group amongst the Shia before the Safavid Dynasty in the sixteenth century and currently the second largest group, are the closest to the Sunnis and do not believe in the infallibility of Imams after Husayn. Zaydis believe that on the last hour of Zayd ibn Ali, he was betrayed by the people in Kufa who said to him: "May God have mercy on you! What do you have to say on the matter of Abu Bakr and Umar ibn al-Khattab?" Zayd ibn Ali said, "I have not heard anyone in my family renouncing them both nor saying anything but good about them...when they were entrusted with government they behaved justly with the people and acted according to the Qur'an and the Sunnah.". Since Imam Jafar al-Sadiq, Imam Zayd ibn Ali, Imam Abu Hanifa and Imam Malik ibn Anas worked together in Al-Masjid an-Nabawi in Medina along with over 70 other leading jurists and scholars. And Imam Jafar al-Sadiq and Imam Zayd ibn Ali did not them selves write any books.
column3: Les Zaydites, la branche la plus ancienne du chiisme et le plus grand groupe parmi les chiites avant la dynastie safavide au XVIe siècle et actuellement le deuxième plus grand groupe, sont les plus proches des sunnites et ne croient pas en l'infaillibilité des Imams après Husayn. Les Zaydites croient que sur la dernière heure de Zayd ibn Ali, il a été trahi par les gens de Kufa qui lui dirent: "Que Dieu ait pitié de toi! Qu'est-ce que vous avez à dire sur la question d'Abou Bakr et Omar ibn al Khattab? " Zayd ibn Ali dit: "J'ai entendu personne dans ma famille renonçant à tous les deux, ni dire autre chose que du bien à leur sujet ... quand ils ont été confiés avec le gouvernement, ils se comportaient justement avec le peuple et agirent selon le Coran et la Sunna". Depuis l'Imam Jafar al-Sadiq, l'Imam Zayd ibn Ali, l'Imam Abou Hanifa et l'Imam Malik ibn Anas travaillèrent ensemble dans Masjid al-Nabawi à Médine avec plus de 70 grands juristes et savants. Et l'Imam Jafar al-Sadiq et l'Imam Zayd ibn Ali n'ont pas écrit eux-mêmes de livre.

column2: Qadariyya was a theological movement in early Islam which held that man was endowed by God with free will. Qadariyya resisted the Umayyad Caliphs' claims to be ordained rulers of all Muslims by God himself, and for that reason some its proponents, the Qadarites, supported the Abbasid revolution. The Qadarites claimed to be ideological descendants of Hasan al-Basri.
Illyrian paganism is a highly unorganized religion based on the worship of sacred places. The holiness of the temples themselves was placed much higher than the dieites they worshiped there.
column3: Le paganisme illyrien est une religion très inorganisé basée sur le culte des lieux sacrés. La sainteté des temples eux-mêmes a été élevée plus haute que les divinités qu'ils adoraient là.

column2: The faith of the West Germans is originating from the divisions caused from mainstream Germanic practices, historically caused by the Saxons isolation in the isles.
column3: La foi des Germains de l'Ouest est originaire des divisions causées par les pratiques germaniques traditionnels, historiquement causés par l'isolement Saxons dans les îles.

column2: Germanic Paganism is a diverse and one of the most original branch of paganism, never conquered by Romans, Germanic Polytheism thrived in Spain and Germany. Bearing multiple similar deities to the Norse, Germanic Paganism is the oldest branch of this line.
column3: Le paganisme germanique est une branche diversifiée et une des plus originales du paganisme, jamais conquis par les Romains, le polythéisme germanique prospéra en Espagne et en Allemagne. Ayant de multiples divinités semblables à celles des nordiques, le paganisme germanique est la branche la plus ancienne de cette lignée.

column2: The reformed Germanic faith compiles many of the different regional gods and holy groves into a central text, along with many other sagas regarding the plights of the heros.
column3: La foi germanique réformée compile un grand nombre de dieux régionaux et des bosquets sacrés dans un texte central, ainsi que de nombreux autres sagas concernant les souffrances des héros.

column2: Worship of the Libyan god Gurzil, the offspring of Amun and a cow.
column3: Culte de la Jamahiriya dieu Gurzil, la progéniture de Amun et une vache.

column2: Änti is the Berber name of the Greek legendary hero Antaeus, a great giant who challenged all he could find in wrestling matches, kill them and collect their skulls so that he could one day built out of them a temple to his father Poseidon. It is said that he was eventually stopped by Hercules who crushed the great giant in a great hold. The worshipers of Änti are tasked with defending their holy site of Msoura, said to be the grave of the long dead sea Giant.
column3: Antée est le nom berbère du héros légendaire grec Antaeus, un grand géant qui a défiait à la lutte tous les voyageurs, les tuait et recueillait leurs crânes afin qu'il puisse un jour construire avec eux un temple pour son père Poséidon. On dit qu'il a finalement été arrêté par Hercule qui a étouffé le grand géant. Les adorateurs de Anti sont chargés de défendre leur site sacré de Msoura, censé être la tombe du grand géant de la mer.

column2: Ashurianism is the polytheistic faith of the Assyrians. Originating from the city state of Assur, the Assyrian faith would spread across Egypt, Babylon and Anatolia following the rise of the Neo-Assyrian Empire in the 10th Century BC. The Assyrians worshiped the god Ashur chiefly but also worshiped other Mesopotamian spirits, personal 'guardian spirits' and even the Monarch of Assyria themselves, it being believed that they were the mortal servant of Ashur sent to enact his will on earth. In Assyrian mythology it is said that if the Assyrians were to stop conquering the world would be brought to an end.
§Y*§! Can reform the Neo-Assyrian Empire\n§Y*§! Assyrian rulers are especially aggressive

Solar Worship in Africa can be seen to be one of the earliest religions on the planet, while the practices and myths surrounding the Sun and the Moon would vary depending on the tribe the most common elements include Ancestor Worship and Animal Sacrifice.
column3: Le culte solaire en Afrique peut être considéré comme l'une des premières religions de la planète, alors que les pratiques et les mythes entourant le Soleil et la Lune  varient en fonction de la tribu les éléments les plus communs comprennent le Culte Ancestral et le Sacrifice Animal.

column2: The Reformed African Solar faith focuses on the worship of the sun, Takafukt in the Berber language.
column3: La foi réformée solaire africaine se concentre sur le culte du soleil, Takafukt dans la langue berbère.

column2: Solar worship in the Roman world was began in 274 when the Roman emperor Aurelian made the cult of Sol Invictus, "The Unconquered Sun" a official cult alongside the traditional Roman cults. The Sol Invictus cult was favored by emperors after Aurelian and appeared on their coins until Constantine.
column3: Le culte solaire dans le monde romain a commencé en 274 quand l'empereur romain Aurélien a fait le culte de Sol Invictus, "Le Soleil Invaincu" un culte officiel aux côtés des cultes romains traditionnels. Le culte Sol Invictus a été favorisé par les empereurs après Aurélien et est apparu sur leurs pièces de monnaie jusqu'à Constantin.

column2: The Reformed Latin Solar faith focuses on worship of the Sun God Sol Invictus, the unconquered Sun.
column3: La foi réformée latine solaire se concentre sur le culte du Dieu Soleil Sol Invictus, le Soleil invaincu.

column2: Worship of the Nubian god Mandulis, a corruption of Horus.
column3: Culte de la Nubie dieu Mandoulis, une corruption de Horus.

column2: The indigenous religious beliefs and practices of African peoples include various traditional religions. While generalizations of these religions are difficult, due to the diversity of African cultures, they do have some characteristics in common. Generally, they are oral rather than scriptural, include belief in a supreme being, belief in spirits and other divinities, veneration of ancestors, use of magic, and traditional medicine. The role of humanity is generally seen as one of harmonizing nature with the supernatural. Traditional African religions have been passed down from one generation to another orally and can be found through art, rituals and festivals, beliefs and customs, names of people and places, songs and dances, proverbs, and myths.
The reformed Droemnät faith has creating a Shamanic order, and set of books detailing the exploits of all the gods.

The Cybelian Mysteries were one of the last surviving of the Hellenic Mystery Cults, only being driven from Rome in the beginning of the 5th Century. Cybelian power continued in Africa for many more years.

Though similar to Hellenism with the worship of Jupiter (known as Mastiman) and Saturn, it differs mostly in the regards of sacrifice and the view of the gods. The practitioners of Mastimani sacrificed children to Saturn and Mastiman, along with an assortment of other human sacrifices. This was in order to appease the gods, who were feared by the devoted.
Philosophical system mixing Platonic ideas and oriental mysticism. It holds that all existence consists of emanations from the One with whom the soul may be reunited.
column3: Système philosophique mélangeant des idées platoniciennes et le mysticisme oriental. Il estime que toute existence est constituée d'émanations de Celui pour qui l'âme peut être réunie.

column2: Georgian paganism is an obscure and diverse religion, centered on a variety of gods, and the heroes they champion. Major gods include Armazi, Dali, Adgilis Deda, and Tamari.
column3: Le paganisme géorgien est une religion obscure et diversifiée, centrée sur une variété de dieux et de héros qu'ils défendent. Les principaux dieux comprennent Armazi, Dali, Adgilis Deda, et Tamari.

column2: Priscillianists were followers of Gnostic-Manichaean dualism, a belief in the existence of two kingdoms, one of Light and one of Darkness. Known equally for their asceticism and purity, but also for their violent zeal, the Priscillians demanded that all clergy become vegetarians. In contrast to many other Gnostic heresies, Priscillianists did not reject the Bible (though they did believe in many Gnostic apocryphal texts) or condemn the Judeo-Christian God. Angels and the souls of men were said to be severed from the substance of God. Human souls were intended to conquer the Kingdom of Darkness, but failed and were imprisoned in material bodies by the Darkness. Thus both kingdoms were represented in man, and hence a conflict symbolized on the side of Light by God, and His Servants, the Twelve Patriarchs- heavenly spirits -who corresponded to certain of man's powers, and on the side of Darkness by the Signs of the Zodiac, the symbols of matter and the lower kingdom. After God's twelve heavenly spirits having failed to accomplish the souls' release, God sent Jesus the Savior (called "Christgod"), who came in a heavenly body which appeared to be like that of other men, and through His doctrine, Death, and His Ressurection released the human souls. The Priscillianists were eventually targeted by Saint Augustine himself for denouncement as a dangerous heresy. In his book, "De Mendacio", St. Augustine attacked the sect because it explicitly allowed its followers to lie. After Priscillian's dubious execution for sorcery, the Pope issued a decree in Leon that all bishops of the region were to engange in carnivorous behavior alone, down to cooking vegetables in meat, to purge the "taint of Priscillian" from the sympathetic clergy.
column3: Le fondement de la doctrine des Priscillianistes était le dualisme gnostique-manichéen, la croyance en l'existence de deux royaumes, l'un de la Lumière et l'autre des Ténèbres. Les anges et les âmes des hommes ont été dites retranchées de la substance de la Divinité. Les âmes humaines étaient destinées à conquérir le royaume des ténèbres, mais sont tombés et ont été emprisonnés dans des corps matériels. Ainsi, les deux royaumes étaient représentés dans l'homme, et donc un conflit symbolisé sur le côté de la lumière par les Douze Patriarches, esprits célestes, qui correspondaient à certains des pouvoirs de l'homme, et du côté des ténèbres par les signes du zodiaque, les symboles de la matière et le royaume inférieur. Le salut de l'homme consiste à la libération de la domination de la matière. Les douze esprits célestes ayant échoué à accomplir leur libération, le Sauveur est venu dans un corps céleste qui semblait être comme celle des autres hommes, et par sa doctrine et sa mort apparente a libéré les âmes des hommes de l'influence de la matière terrestre.

column2: §Y*§! Devout Priscillians may become vegetarians.\n§Y*§! Can found a Holy Order if the Bishop of Avila is empowered. \n§Y*§!Priscillians may elevate the Bishop of Avila if they manage to control Avila alongside a large realm.

Gnosticism refers to a diverse, syncretistic religious movement consisting of various belief systems generally united in the teaching that humans are divine souls trapped in a material world created by an imperfect god, the demiurge, who is frequently identified with the Abrahamic God in some sects. Gnosticism is a rejection (sometimes from an ascetic perspective) and vilification of the human body and of the material world or cosmos. Gnosticism teaches duality in Material (Matter) versus Spiritual or Body (evil) versus Soul (good). Gnosticism teaches that the natural or material world will and should be destroyed (total annihilation) by the true spiritual God in order to free mankind from the reign of the false God or Demiurge.
column3: Le gnosticisme renvoie à un mouvement religieux diversifié, syncrétiste composé de différents systèmes de croyance généralement unis dans l'enseignement que les humains sont des âmes divines piégés dans un monde matériel créé par un dieu imparfait, le démiurge, qui est souvent identifié avec le Dieu abrahamique. Le gnosticisme est un rejet (parfois à partir d'un point de vue ascétique) et de dénigrement du corps humain et du monde matériel ou du cosmos. Le gnosticisme enseigne la dualité dans le Matériel (Matter) contre le Spirituel ou le Corps (le mal) contre l'Âme (bien). Le gnosticisme enseigne que le monde naturel ou matériel sera et doit être détruit (anéantissement total) par le vrai Dieu spirituel afin de libérer l'humanité du règne du faux Dieu ou Démiurge.

column2: Sanamahism is the worship of Sanamahi as the eternal force responsible for all living things. This collection of this faith's beliefs is the Puya, written in Manipuri.
column3: Le sanamahisme est le culte de Sanamahi comme la force éternelle responsable de tous les êtres vivants. Cette collection de croyances de cette foi est la Puya, écrit en Manipuri.

column2: The Mithraic Mysteries were a mystery religion practiced in the Roman Empire from about the 1st to 4th centuries AD. The name of the Persian god Mithra, adapted into Greek as Mithras, was linked to a new and distinctive imagery. Writers of the Roman Empire period referred to this mystery religion by phrases which can be anglicized as Mysteries of Mithras or Mysteries of the Persians. The mysteries were popular in the Roman military. Worshipers of Mithras had a complex system of seven grades of initiation, with ritual meals. Initiates called themselves syndexioi, those "united by the handshake". They met in underground temples, which survive in large numbers. The cult appears to have had its centre in Rome.
column3: Les Mystères de Mithra étaient une religion de mystère pratiquée dans l'Empire romain à partir du 1er jusqu'au 4ème siècle de notre ère. Le nom du dieu persan Mithra, adapté en grec comme Mithras, était lié à une imagerie nouvelle et distinctive. Les écrivains contemporains de l'Empire romain désignèrent cette mystérieuse religion par des phrases qui peuvent être francisées comme Mystères de Mithra ou Mystères des Perses. Les mystères étaient populaires dans l'armée romaine. Les adorateurs de Mithra avaient un système complexe de sept degrés d'initiation, avec des repas rituels. Les initiés se sont appelés syndexioi, ceux "unis par la poignée de main". Ils se sont rencontrés dans les temples souterrains, qui survivent en grand nombre. Le culte semble avoir eu son centre à Rome.

column2: Semitic Paganism is a diverse belief carried by the nomads of the Arabian desert. Semitic paganism is centered on the worship of natural events such as fire or rain. Many of the Semitic deities are heavily influenced by the Mesopotamian Religions.
column3: Le paganisme sémitique est une croyance diversifiée portée par les nomades du désert d'Arabie. Le paganisme sémitique est centrée sur le culte des événements naturels tels que le feu ou la pluie. Beaucoup de divinités sémitiques sont fortement influencés par les religions mésopotamiennes.

column2: The united Kaabaite faith centered around the Kaaba has a religious head, the Alab, a written collection of proper rituals and a guide on living in harmony with the gods.
§Y*§! Defensive bonuses in Semitic lands.\n§Y*§! Can demand conversion and convert provinces.
Hubalism is a fringe monotheistic sect originating from Monophysite influences in Mecca. Anti-Clerical, this religion also is welcoming of women into its ranks and has very strict marriage laws.
The traditional beliefs of the Dravidians were isolated, yet in some was similar to the Vedic traditions to the north.
column3: Les croyances traditionnelles des Dravidiens étaient isolées, mais d'une certaine manière étaient semblables aux traditions védiques du nord.

column2: The reformed Dravidian faith contains a uniform religious text, which details the various gods and their exploits.
column3: La foi dravidien réformée contient un texte religieux uniforme, qui détaille les divers dieux et leurs exploits.

column2: Central African paganism describes the diverse and complicated religion practiced by the various tribal groups in North Africa. Placing high worship in the Sun and Moon, the believers have also been influenced by many other cultures, incorporating Roman, Greek, Egyptian, and Carthaginian gods into their pantheon.

Central African paganism describes the diverse and complicated religion practiced by the various tribal groups in North Africa. Placing high worship in the Sun and Moon, the believers have also been influenced by many other cultures, incorporating Roman, Greek, Egyptian, and Carthaginian gods into their pantheon.

Scythian Paganism refers to the mythology, ritual practices and beliefs of the Scythians, an ancient Iranian people who dominated Central Asia and the Pontic-Caspian steppe in Eastern Europe throughout Classical Antiquity. What little is known of the religion is drawn from the work of the 5th century Greek historian and ethnographer Herodotus. Scythian religion is assumed to have been related to the earlier Proto-Indo-Iranian religion, and to have influenced later Slavic, Hungarian and Turkic mythologies, as well as some contemporary Eastern Iranian and Ossetian traditions.
column3: Agini se réfère à la mythologie, les pratiques et les croyances rituelles des Scythes, un ancien peuple iranien qui domina l'Asie centrale et la steppe pontique-Caspienne en Europe tout au long de l'Antiquité classique. Le peu que l'on connaît de la religion est tirée de l'œuvre de l'historien et ethnographe grec du 5ème siècle Hérodote. La religion scythe est supposée avoir été liée à la religion antérieure proto-indo-iranienne, et avoir influencé plus tard les mythologies slaves, hongroises et turques, ainsi que certaines traditions contemporaines iraniennes et ossètes de l'Est.

column2: The reformed Iranian paganism contains a holy book of scriptures, guides to rituals, and codified deities.
column3: Le paganisme iranien réformé contient un livre saint des écritures, des guides pour les rituels et les divinités codifiées.

column2: The Vasconic religion comes from the last pre-indoeuropan tribe, the Basques, isolated in the Pyrenees, who resisted to the romanisation and kept their local religious customs.
column3: La religion vasconique vient de la dernière tribu pré-indo-européenne, les basques, isolés dans les Pyrénées, qui ont résisté à la romanisation et gardé leurs coutumes religieuses locales.

column2: The reformed Vasconic religion has a religious head, the Zai Gorena and has both a holy book as well as guides to rituals such as the black goat sacrifice, and codified deities.

Zalmoxis, the Thracian death god, who was originally a Greek philosopher, enthralled the Thracians and Dacians with his own religion, Zalmoxianism. Where the Thracians simply added him to their list of dieties, the Dacians worshipped him as the highest of gods.
column6: Zalmoxis, el dios de la muerte tracio, que fue originalmente un filósofo griego, cautivó a los tracios y dacios con su propia religión, el zalmoxianismo. Donde los tracios simplemente le agregaron a su lista de dieties, los dacios lo adoraron como el más alto de dioses.

column2: The reformed Zalmoxist religion has a religious head and a codified organisation in contrast to the decentralised nature of the unreformed faith.

Zurvanism in this sense refers to Fatalistic Zurvanism, a branch of the broader Zurvanist tradition which held that mankind was nothing more than a slave to the movement of the astral bodies of the heavenly sphere, holding that "Ohrmazd allotted happiness to man, but if man did not receive it, it was owing to the extortion of these planets." It would break from the broad Zoroastrian church for this, violating the concept of Free Will, the most sacred tennent of Zoroastrianism.
column3: Le zurvanisme dans ce sens se réfère à zurvanisme fanatique, une branche de la tradition zurvanite qui a jugé que l'humanité n'était rien de plus qu'un esclave du mouvement des corps astraux de la sphère céleste, jugeant que "Ohrmazd attribua le bonheur à l'homme, mais si l'homme ne l'a pas reçu, il était dû à l'extorsion de ces planètes ". Cela briserait la vaste église zoroastrienne pour cela, il ne respecte pas le concept de libre arbitre, l'élément le plus sacré du zoroastrisme.

column2: The sect was founded by the Persian cleric Sunpadh and was a revitalization of an earlier sect that had mixed Shi‘a Islam and Zoroastrianism, however, its true claim to fame was its adoption by Babak Khorramdin as a basis for rebelling against the Abbasid Caliphate.
column3: La secte a été fondée par le religieux persan Sunpadh et était une revitalisation d'une secte antérieure qui avait mélangé l'islam chiite et le zoroastrisme, cependant, son véritable titre de gloire était son adoption par Babak Khorramdin comme base pour se rebeller contre le califat abbasside.

column2: Hephthalism is a syncretic religious sect based on a fusion of Zoroastrian and Hindu traditions with native beliefs. Less a true religion than an amalgam of an accepted many, the Hepthalite religion in game represents the unique combination of Zoroastrian, Tabitian, and Hindu practices all under the auspices of the Rajadhiraja himself.
After the fall of the Bosporan Kingdom, the influx of Thracian and Jewish traditions led to the creation of a Cult of the Most High God, a monotheistic religion unrelated to the Abrahamic faiths.
column3: Après la chute du Royaume du Bosphore, l'afflux de traditions thraces et juives a conduit à la création d'un culte du Dieu suprême, une religion monothéiste sans rapport avec les religions abrahamiques.

column2: Meaning "living" in Sanskrit, Ajivika is an ancient ascetic heterodox Hindu school. It was founded by Makkhali Gosala, and is deeply entrenched in Metaphysics.
column3: Signifiant "vivant" en sanskrit, Ajivika est une ancienne école hindoue hétérodoxe ascétique. Elle a été fondée par Makkhali Gosala, et est profondément enracinée dans la Métaphysique.

column2: Predating Jainism or Buddhism, the Carvaka school is most known for its rejection of inference as a means of establishing metaphysical truths. This school also denied the existence of souls, and the fifth element. They also denied an afterlife, and believed pleasure to be acceptable.
column3: Précédant le jaïnisme et le bouddhisme, l'école chârvâka est plus connu pour son rejet de l'inférence comme un moyen d'établir des vérités métaphysiques. Cette école nia également l'existence d'âmes, et le cinquième élément. Ils refusèrent également l'au-delà, et crurent le plaisir acceptable.

column2: Mimamsa is a heterodox belief system which holds that disregards the Gods, and focuses on the character of Dharma. Highly ritualistic, the Mimamsa is centered on incredibly powerful priests. This sect dominated India in the Gupta era, and led to the decline of Buddhism in India.
column3: Mimâmsâ est un système de croyance hétérodoxe qui stipule l'abstraction des Dieux, et se concentre sur le personnage de Dharma. Hautement ritualiste, le Mimâmsâ est centrée sur prêtres aux pouvoirs incroyables. Cette secte a dominé l'Inde à l'époque Gupta, et a conduit à la baisse du bouddhisme en Inde.

column2: The Tantric school of meditation and ritual was formed from Hindu, Buddhist, Jain, and Bon traditions. Identified by the belief the world is real, and an assortment of secret rituals. Later, many concepts and rituals of Tantrism will be adopted into the Vedic Religions.
column3: L'école tantrique de méditation et de rituel était formé des traditions hindoue, bouddhiste, jain et bön. Identifié par la conviction que le monde est réel, et un assortiment de rituels secrets. Plus tard, de nombreux concepts et rituels du tantrisme seront adoptées dans les religions védiques.

column2: The Bhakti movement taught that salvation was accessible to everyone, and denied caste systems and Brahmanic rituals.
column3: Le mouvement bhakti enseigna que le salut était accessible à tout le monde, et a rejeta les systèmes de castes et les rituels brahmaniques.

column2: The ancient Sramanic teachings are parallel, but separated from Vedic religion. This faith has led to the rise of Buddhism, Jainism, and Carvaka.
column3: Les anciens enseignements chamaniques sont parallèles, mais séparés de la religion védique. Cette foi a conduit à la montée du bouddhisme, jaïnisme et chârvâka.

column2: Khawariji, or "those who went out" is a sect of Islam that arose from he rejection of Ali Ibn Abi Talib's rule in the Caliphate.
Haruriyyah is an early Muslim sect which was an offshoot branch of the Khariji Rectors. They took offense to the use of arbitrators in the Caliphate and had Ali murdered.
has been anointed with the oil and water.
The Blood Brotherhood is the sacred pact between a ritual cult in South Africa. The cult traveled to the North in search of honor and serves any honorable enough to command them.
The Apellian school of Marcionian theology. As revealed to Apellius through a demon speaking through the woman Philumene, the Apellian school is deeply settled in Gnostic rites.
column3: L'école apellianiste de la théologie marcionite. Comme révélé à Apellius par un démon qui parle à travers la femme Philumene, l'école apellianiste est profondément installée dans les rites gnostiques.

column2: Potitianism is the mainstream school of Marcionism, and the form advocated by Marcion himself.
The Synerian school removes most of the questionable content from the Marcionian creed, reorganizing themselves in a more Nicene approved manner.

At long last, the authority of the Puya, the longtime text of the Meetei, has been used as a rallying point for a new and robust revival of the faith! Expunging the foul corruptions of the Dharmic brand of heathenry, a revitalized Sanamahi faith retains the lack of central leadership, yet looks forward under an inviolate and supreme Puya.
§Y*§! Sanamahi provinces must deal with Umangais, local forest deities revered and feared by the faithful peasantry.
Dao is respected by the clergy and especially the head of your Church. It can be spent to petition the head of your Church. Like Prestige, it is added to your score on the death of a ruler

Confucianism is an ethical and philosophical religion founded by Confucius, centered on humanism, awareness, family, and good service. After Confucius' death the religion would gain more metaphysical and supernatural components.
column3: Le confucianisme est une religion philosophique et morale fondée par Confucius, centré sur l'humanisme, la connaissance, la famille, et l'entraide. Après la mort de Confucius la religion allait acquérir plus d'éléments métaphysiques et surnaturels.

column2: Taoism, coming from the word "Tao", meaning "Way", is a religion centered on living in the balance and harmony with The Tao. Highly dualistic, Taoism includes two conflicting forces known as Yin and Yang.
column3: Le taoïsme, d'origine du mot Tao qui veut dire "chemin", est une religion qui est centrée autour d'une vie équilibrée et en harmonie avec le Tao. Très dualiste, le taoïsme comprend deux forces en conflit connues sous les noms de Yin et Yang.

column2: This time period saw a wide range of sects and beliefs, all united under the aegis of the Zoroastrian Church. As a new convert, you must choose one
column3: Cette période a vu un large éventail de sectes et des croyances, tous unis sous l'égide de l'Eglise zoroastrienne. Comme un nouveau converti, vous devez en choisir une.

column2: Mazdeism, the orthodox worship of the primordial twin gods.
Zurvanism, the worship of Time Eternal and the movement of stars.
column3: Le zurvanism, le culte du temps éternel et du mouvement des étoiles.

column2: Siyavashism, the worship of the Hero God of death and ressurection.
The three traditions of Zoroastrianism are Mazdeism, Zurvanism, and Siyavashism. You have decided to choose a new way, but which one shall it be?

Mazdeism is the mainstream school of Zoroastrianism, claiming that Ahura Mazda and Angiru Manu are primordial entities. What more, Mazdeism holds a certain optimism about the human nature, and is staunch in its belief of free will.

This Zurvanist sect is specifically referring to Materialist Zurvanism, believing that Ahura Mazda and Angiru Manu are the twin sons of the primordial Zurvan, a primordial and transcendent god without good or evil.
column3: Cette secte zurvanite fait spécifiquement référence au zurvanisme matérialiste, estimant que Ahura Mazda et Angiru Manu sont les fils jumeaux du Zurvan primordial, un dieu primordial et transcendant sans bien ni mal.

column2: Siyavashism is a smaller sect largely practices in the northern fringes of Iranian culture. Worshipping the legendary hero Siyavash as a god, the sect is heavily influenced by local pagan traditions and theology.
Which sect of Zoroastrianism do you support?
Sanamahism is a diverse religion, with over three hundred and sixty-four gods and goddesses holding dominion over human life. The question is, which one is your patron deity?
Ebundhou Paakhangba, Lord of the Outside World
Ema Panthuoibi, the Goddess of Valor and Battle
Ebedhou Emoinu, the Goddess of Prosperity and the Kitchen
Choose which of the Sanamahi divinities is right for you.

The Root West religion is an ancient, shamanistic faith native to the Tangut peoples. While some Tanguts converted to Buddhism over time, many rural Tanguts clinged to this ancient religion devoted to the worship of cranes and monkeys. Root West rulers are called 'The Red Faced' or 'Redface', and are believed to descend from monkeys, or to have been granted the right to rule by them. Root West clergymen are called the Black Headed, due to their black robes and black felt hats. They perform an intercessory role between the Red Faced and the gods and exercise control over over the people faith's orthodoxy.

§Y*§! Being a Redface is a great honor: bestowing this to your kin grants you Prestige \n§Y*§! Attacking your fellow Redface costs Piety \n§Y*§! Syncretized with Buddhism, can intermarry with Buddhists

After centuries of syncretization and being eaten away by the Buddhist faith, a charismatic Redface has united the disparate Root West shamans under one authority! Worship of cranes and monkeys, use and depiction of clergy vestments, and other aspects of faith have been standardized, and the myriad of musicals, sonnets, and odes of worship, along with the defenitive Great Ode, have been combined into one universal hymnal. A central liturgy now exists for each holy animal and sacrament. The powerful Black Headed clergy have always exercised intercession and excommunication duties among Root West settlements, but now a centralized Black Intercessor excercises authority over all the Redfaced and worshippers everywhere.

§Y*§! Being a Redface is a great honor: bestowing this to your kin grants you Prestige \n§Y*§! Attacking your fellow Redface costs Piety \n§Y*§! Syncretized with Buddhism, can intermarry with Buddhists
has gone black and won't go back
has gone black and won't go back

Melchisedechianism is a mysticist Christian sect that considers Melchisedech (or Malchizedek), the Priest-King of Salem, an incarnation of the Logos and identified him with the Holy Ghost. They held that the Sabbath was the holiest of days and gifted food must be placed on the ground, and then picked up by the recipiant. Melchisedechians consider parts of Genesis to be "Logia Melchizedek", that is, Melchizedek's Sayings, and hold that Melchizedek established a parallel, spiritual priesthood that was truly formed by his later incarnation as Jesus, in His role as High Priest In the Order of Melchizedek. Most of what is known about the Melchisedechian sect is found in Gnostic books and documents and a Catholic rebuttal text called "Against the Melchisedekites". The Melchisedechian Eucharist uniquely featured both the presence of fans and of a central flame, where the holy bread was deposited at the end of the ritual. Although the actual Melchisedechian sect died out by the end of the ninth century, the known rituals and mysticism of the sect saw an occultist revival in the 1990s AD.
§Y*§! Can found a Holy Order if Salem is created.\n§Y*§! Can instate an incarnation of the ancient Kingdom of Salem if the faith is powerful enough.
Either you, or any vassal, must control the fringes of Upper Samaria (the counties of Acre and Tiberias) /n
